comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Some background history, including this photo - lordbelmontinnorthernireland.blogspot.com.au/2012/01/kilb...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: "... Another noteworthy inclusion [to a book] is Ryanair co-founder Tony Ryan, who changed the face of European aviation after he established the low fares airline in 1985. A Thurles native who lived just outside Nenagh at Kilboy House, Ryan’s entrepreneurial genius saw him amass a fortune of €1.5 billion before his death in 2007. ... " from www.nenaghguardian.ie/news-detail.php?article=FYTJRT

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Nice little blog post, and this photo plus the image and description of the house confirms that it was taken at Kilboy. And Tony Ryan living there is another priceless little nugget of information. Thank you!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: The Landed Estates Database at NUIG has a reference, and the additional images page at the NIAH shows the steps today.

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content:
Henry Desmond Graham Prittie, 6th Baron Dunalley of Kilboy
b.<u>14 October 1912</u>, d.1992........... so 21st birthday photo!!.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: The Pritties in residence in 1911 were the grandparents, Henry Callaghan and Mary Frances. Desmond's parents were Henry Cornelius Callaghan Prittie and Beatrix Evelyn née Graham. Young Henry Desmond was the later the 6th Baron Dunalley, and lived until 1992.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] Google Chrome has a new feature. Right-click the image to view Original. Right-click the Original and "Search Google for this image" It appears on lordbelmontinnorthernireland.blogspot.co.uk/2012/01/kilbo...

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] Here's a portrait of Henry Cornelius. Moustache, centre-parting, I think he's Mr. Grumpy Darksuit.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Here's Lady Dunalley and Family at the National Portrait Gallery (UK) in 1933.

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Looks like your Grumpy Darksuit is the father all right. Not a happy camper!!.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] He looks like Rufus Hound! i1.cdnds.net/11/04/tv_rufus_hound.jpg

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Delighted to have 3 people identified! Thanks a million...

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content:
The woman behind the mum reminds me of Honoria Glossop as represented in the Jeeves and Wooster TV series.

I know, I know: middle age is when everyone you see reminds you of somebody else.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: A better moustache. I think this must be the grandfather, from the 1911 census above, who died in 1927.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8468254@N02] I see what you mean about Honoria Glossop!

comment.author: 105404256@N06
comment._content: Happy Birthday Dad! Desmond is my father. Born Oct 14th 1912.  My grandad had that frown from being wounded and left for dead in WW1.

comment.author: 105404256@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] It looks like they're identified correctly, Desmond's parents were the frowning man in the dark suit and the woman on the right.

comment.author: 80456351@N00
comment._content: Grumpy Darksuit indeed. They are all looking sharp, for the gentlemen, and elegant, for the ladies. (Back then there were ladies and gents).

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/105404256@N06] Hello MikePrittie!  Who is that in the window at right?  Mrs Danvers?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/105404256@N06] Hello there - always absolutely delighted to hear from a family member! Can you identify anyone else in the photo for us?

comment.author: 105404256@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Ha ha... No idea I'm afraid.

comment.author: 105404256@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] It's a shame but I'm afraid not. The house looks magnificent now though. The Ryan's have restored it back to its original appearance.

comment.author: 105404256@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] The Ryans have since restored Kilboy back to its original appearance in 1778. An amazing project. The bungalow in those pictures is no more.

comment.author: 54719673@N03
comment._content: É sempre bom ver fotos antigas.
